title: Import Content Packs to the Dependencies Pane
content:
As an author you can import the content packs created using OO Workflow Designer (CloudSlang content packs) and OO Desktop Studio (OO native content packs).

Import content packs to the workspace

Before importing the content packs you must prepare the content packs to be imported:

Certificate Status Icon Description Deployment State
  • Digital signature or Content pack is altered
 This content pack can't be deployed.
  • Digital signature is expired
  • Content Pack isn't signed
  • Content Pack is signed but the signed CA isn't in the client.truststore
 This content pack can be deployed.
  • Digital signature has passed and the signature's CA is known to OO Workflow Designer.
 This content pack can be deployed.

  1. Locate your required Content Packs, consider to:

    • Use the content packs that were included when you installed OO Workflow Designer.
    • Make sure to import a base content pack first as it's a dependency for all the other content packs before importing a content pack.
    • Download additional content packs from ITOM Marketplace.
    • Create content packs from existing CloudSlang content.

  2. Click the Import Content Pack button in the Dependencies pane.

  3. In the Import Content Pack dialog box, click New .

  4. In the browse dialog, select one or more content packs and click Open to upload. You can also drag and drop from the browse dialog.

  5. When you upload a content pack, OO Workflow Designer checks the content pack for a digital signature. The following are the possible certificate statuses you may see:

  6. Click on the certificate icon to view the details of the certificate and the issuing authority.

  7. If all selected content packs are digitally signed and successfully uploaded, the Import button is enabled.

    If any of the content packs digital signature fails or were already imported, the Import button isn't disabled.

    You must remove the invalid or corrupted content packs from the dialog box. To do that:

    • Select a content pack that has digital signature issues or duplicate content packs and click the Delete button to remove it.
    • Or click the Clear button to clear all displayed content packs from the dialog box and restart the process of uploading content packs. The default size limit of content packs that can be uploaded to OO Workflow Designer is 200 MB. However, you can configure this size limit.

  8. After the content packs are successfully uploaded, click the Import button. The progress bar of the import content pack progress appears at the bottom.

    If any of the content packs weren't successfully imported, click Clear to start a new import process.

  9. Click Close. The successfully imported content packs are displayed in the Dependencies pane.

Assign an imported content pack

In a multi author environment, two users accessing the same OO Workflow Designer instance can view and assign a content pack already imported by another user from their workspace to own workspace. This results in not having to reimport the same content pack that authors might need. The assigned and imported content pack is read-only, which means the user who imports the content pack can use its flows in the working projects but can't edit them.

For example, if user A has imported the content pack, then user B accessing the same OO Workflow Designer service can view, assign, and import an already imported content pack to own workspace.

It must be noted that this functionality is disabled by default due to security reasons.

Assign content pack

To assign an already imported content pack, complete the steps as follows:

  1. Click the Import Content Pack button in the Dependencies pane.

  2. In the Import Content Pack dialog box, click Assign button. The content pack/s imported by another user is/are listed.

  3. From the Assign Content Pack dialog box, select the content pack/s listed, pick the desired version, and then click Assign. The content pack/s is assigned to the current workspace.

    If the Assign button isn't visible, contact your administrator to enable this feature for your workspace.

Enable assign content pack feature

The administrator has to post the following API call to enable a user to assign a content pack to another user within the workspace.

Request

POST /oo-designer/rest/v0/xfeatures/{workspace_id}

Description

Enables an assign content pack feature to the workspace ID.

Sample

curl -X POST --header "Content-Type: application/json" --header "Accept: */*" --header "X-CSRF-TOKEN: f2e55754-1681-4d89-b8d2-918b478e522c" -d "{
  \"name\": \"assign_cp\",
  \"visible\": true
}" "https://<FQDN>:<PORT>/oo-designer/rest/v0/xfeatures/312"

Response status codes

Code Meaning Returned When
200 OK The assign content pack feature is enabled.

Response entity body

{
    "assign_cp":true,
    "hybrid_debugger":true,
    "open_afl":true,
    "debugger":true,
    "hybrid_authoring":true
}

Filter the dependencies

To view specific items in the dependencies pane:

  1. Enter search text into the Filter tree box.

    For example, enter "ping" to display only flows, decisions, operations, folders, and system properties files containing "ping". If the text is part of a folder name, all the contents of that folder, including sub folders, are displayed.

  2. To remove a filter, click the x at the side of the Filter tree box.

View the details of a read-only item from the dependencies pane

While you can't edit a flow/operation from the Dependencies pane, you can view its details in the Authoring pane.

  1. Select the flow/operation in the Dependencies pane.
  2. Double-click the flow/operation to display it as read-only in the Authoring pane. A Read-only icon appears in the tab, next to the name. If there is no open flow in the Authoring pane, you can also open the item by dragging it to the Authoring pane. However, if there is already an flow in the Authoring pane, the act of dragging the item will move it to that flow.

Identifying content packs created without using OO Workflow Designer

If you had imported Content packs that were created without using OO Workflow Designer, you can:

  • View that the configuration elements of the content packs are disabled for use for now.

  • Open the Flows, Operations, System Accounts, and System Properties.
  • Analyze the Flows and Operations before use. You can double click on the flows from the Dependencies pane to view its inputs, outputs, results, and descriptions as in the following image.
Tip Select the flows or operations from the authoring canvas and click the Drill Down into the Step button to view more details
  • You can open the System Accounts and System Properties of the native OO content pack by double clicking from the Dependencies pane to view the details as in the following image.

Related topics

  • To configure the content pack size limit, see Configure content pack import size.
  • To use external CloudSlang files, see Use CloudSlang files created outside OO Workflow Designer.Â
